Today, HealthKeeperz is known for their commitment to caring for the diverse and ever-changing needs of the individuals and families they serve. With a focus on at-home care, they strive to help their clients avoid the hospital while receiving compassionate, professional care in a place they feel most comfortable. This is made possible through their commitment to upholding their unique Barnabas culture. Based on the biblical figure of Barnabas, this culture emphasizes caring, selflessness, humility, and a passion for serving the community at large. The company has achieved the highest standard of community-based care through its Barnabas values. As a part of this culture, company team members are recognized each year at an annual Barnabas Awards ceremony, highlighting those who have gone above and beyond in living out the company’s mission.  HealthKeeperz takes a curative approach to care, supporting the health and comfort of individuals within the privacy and comfort of their home. Through their services, patients can access a range of care options, including Medicare Certified Home Health, Medicare Certified Hospice Care, CAP Case Management Services, and home medical equipment and supplies.  The HealthKeeperz various teams provide a wide variety of services from medication administration to assisting with daily activities to educating patient families. In addition, patients can take part in physical, occupational, and speech therapy to improve health outcomes and quality of life. These services are personalized to each patient and seek to support their physical, emotional, and spiritual health. The company’s home medical equipment department has received accreditation from The Accreditation Commission for Health Care. Additionally, HealthKeeperz is a member of The NC Association of Home and Hospice Care, The NC Association of Medical Equipment Suppliers, and The Carolinas Center for Hospice and End of Life Care. They are licensed by The NC Division of Health Service Regulation and the SC Department of Health and Environmental Control and are certified by Medicare and Medicaid. Built by the community for the community, HealthKeeperz is a testament to the power of strong leadership and genuine care for people. Since their humble beginnings as a small pharmacy, founder Howard Brooks and his team grew the company into what it is today, always keeping excellence and compassion in mind. That legacy of leadership continues today with current President Tim Brooks and the rest of the leadership team.

Three Aspects of Automation You Might Have Missed Automation continues to gradually make its way into the mainstream. For example, commercials depicting homeowners monitoring their home remotely, setting thermostats based on useage and programming lights and music is quite mainstream, showcasing some of the nifty every day uses of machine-to-machine (M2M) technology and IoT gateways. The applications of building automation, however, go far beyond what you may have seen in advertisements. In fact, automation can be utilized by companies across nearly every vertical. What follows are a few “hidden” automation applications.   Payment Processing Automated payment systems supported by best-in-class gateways perform a wide range of functions, from facilitating faster credit card transactions to verifying customer membership in loyalty programs. Automated payment system applications also allow remote monitoring of point-of-service systems and terminals for security and performance assurance purposes. Printing  Print automation can increase employee productivity by allowing managers to create ironclad rules that govern business processes. For instance, a point-of-sale device can be set up to print a receipt any time a sale is entered. Or the printer in a commercial warehouse could be configured to print a packing slip when an order is confirmed in the system, eliminating the need for human intervention and error. Automated solutions can also collect and analyze data on a company’s printing, identifying areas of waste or inefficiency. Data Processing Data access and collection devices can enhance a business’s existing infrastructure by re-routing information over the Internet of private IP networks instead of dial-up lines. These devices allow for faster transfer of data and cost savings reaped by eliminating telephone lines. Best-in-class Dial-to-IP converters also come with SSL encryption to secure data and embedded back-up to protect against data loss.     If you were under the impression building automation was only good for monitoring HVAC or lighting systems from afar, perhaps it’s time to take another look. Because no matter what space you occupy, the technology holds some benefits for your business.
